chapter.title: Component descriptors
chapter.para: A component description file describes the properties of a component. This set of properties is used by the controller to find out about the service URL of the component, its type, accepted input and output data formats etc.

Component descriptors files are normally distributed with a certain component. In &carrot; project &cvs;, there is a designated folder for component descriptors (see ). During a global build process, component descriptors from that directory automatically copied to the controller component and used at runtime.
The structure of a component descriptor file is defined by an &xml; schema, see example below.

A typical component descriptor must provide an identification string (assigned by &carrot; &cvs; maintainer), its type and &http; &post; service &url;. Optional elements include an &url; to component's information Web page, configuration Web page and specification of input and output stream formats.
